data.title: Staff
data.meta_site_name: Har Zion Temple | A Jewish Temple for Conservative Judaism in Penn Valley, PA
data.text:
Emily Berton

Assistant Executive Director

eberton@harziontemple.org

610-667-5000x109

Emily is handling all scheduling on the Har Zion Temple calendar. She is responsible for all private and organization rentals and Bar and Bat Mitzvahs, including extended kiddushes. Emily handles all inside events, from our schools, constituent groups and lay leaders of the congregation. She also orders all of the food for the kitchen in addition to providing a variety of other kitchen support and supervision of kitchen staff. Emily also handles membership related items ranging from accepting potential or new member questions, updating member information, taking all RSVPs for congregational events, and being there to assist with anything a member might need. If you need help, direction and a smile at Har Zion Temple – see Emily!

Emily has also been handling our payroll and bank reconciliations for the bookkeeping office, and most recently she has undertaken the maintenance coordination of our building. She has proven to have excellent administrative skills and a thorough familiarity of HZT and she is eager to continue learning and expanding her role.

Dawn Collins

Office Coordinator

dcollins@harziontemple.org

610-667-5000 x108

Whether over the phone or in person, Dawn is the first to greet you and try to help. Whether you’re making a donation or just trying to reach other staff, Dawn is happy to take care of you. And when she’s not greeting people, she’s helping out with a variety of administrative tasks in the front office, including all aspects of accounts payable – from placing orders, checking bills and writing checks to keeping all of our records well organized. If you need to buy something or get a bill paid – Dawn will take care of it.

Norman Einhorn

BMitzvah Coordinator and Director of Member Engagement

neinhorn@harziontemple.org

610-667-5000 x150

Norman started his Har Zion career as a Hebrew School teacher in the fall of 1986 after studying for a semester at Hebrew University in Jerusalem. Today he is the Director Engagement and Programming, and Director of the Lower Merion Area Hebrew High, a community high school of which Har Zion Temple is a founding member. He has been married to Debbie for more than 25 years (Lord give her strength!) and has two amazing kids- Ethan and Alli. Norman believes that the foundation to every successful synagogue or school is a successful relationship. Please come visit – there is a lot of candy in Norman’s office and he’s on a diet!

Gavi Miller

Executive Director

gmiller@harziontemple.org

610-667-5000 x105

As our Executive Director, Gavi spends his time working with the accounting and administration staff, helping the senior staff and lay leadership, and serving the congregation, trying to make Har Zion Temple the best it can be. When you have a problem and are not sure where to turn, his door is always open. You’ll find him striving to solve problems: from equipment or technology issues, to improving organizational dynamics, to interfacing with staff, lay leaders, congregants and vendors.

Rabbi Shawn SimonHazani

Director of Lifelong Learning

rabbishawn@harziontemple.org

610-667-5000 x114

Rabbi Shawn oversees Jewish education in all its forms at Har Zion Temple. Learning is his passion and he hopes to share this love of all Jewish learning with you and your family. This includes religious school, youth group activities, adult education and more. Whether you want to study in small groups or in a class formal or informal, academic or otherwise – the Lifelong Learning team is happy to try and help you meet your learning goals.

Sandi Toben

Director of Early Childhood Education

stoben@harziontemple.org

610-667-5000 x115

Sandi runs our Noreen Cook Center for Early Childhood Education. Her passion for fostering young minds and instilling a love of learning has led her to a career in early childhood education that started in her teen years as a camp counselor. You can most likely find Sandi engaged with our littlest learners, exploring outdoors, or reading a good book. Contact her if you are interested in learning about our exciting programing for 18 months to Kindergarten-aged children.
